Description: Granodiorite statue of Senusret III wearing nemes; prenomen on belt; legs and arms lost(hands still present on apron).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Mentuhotep, Lower South Court
Curator's comments: Published: HTBM 4: Plate 8 PM II (2): p.384 See discussion of stylistic differences amongst EA 685 and EA 686: Mueller, in In R. Nyord and A. Kjølby (eds), ‘Being in Ancient Egypt’. Thoughts on agency, materiality and cognition. Proceedings of the seminar held in Copenhagen, September 29–30, 2006. BAR International Series 2019. Oxford, 51
Bibliographic references: Verri and Saunders 2014 / Xenon flash for reflectance and luminescence (multispectral) imaging in cultural heritage applications (p.84, fig.1, p.90, fig.7, p.91)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Senusret III
